page.title: 20Survivors of a bombing
page.content: When the bomb exploded on{Beacon Downe Sir Richard's wife and two daughters, his mother,two sisters and their children,nanny,the gardener and his wife were in the house,an old mainly Georgian dwelling with Victorian additions.Sir Richard's wife was found in the cellar with her back and both legs broken.His two year old daughter also fell to the cellar from the top of the house but was saved by a box spring mattress which had blown off a double bed in the same room and landed like a tent over her cot.The main stairway had disappeared bringing down a lot of the house.There was no fire though and much of the reusable material was taken away to repair houses damaged in the Exeter blitz of May 1942. By 1963 a new house was finally built and we photographed it for the Domesday survey.Neil & Susan
